intro: Thymophylla pentachaeta var. hartwegii, commonly known as Hartweg's thymophylla, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and ecologically significant species in its native habitat.
